page.title: 07THE MINERS STRIKE 1984
page.content: In the 8th month my dad got a bit fed up so he decided to back to work. We all begged him not to but he did. That Friday morning there were police cars and riot vans coming to our house every five minutes. The next day people were shouting 'scab' as they passed our house. It upset me and my family, I dare not go to school in case they called me scab. The first day nobody said anything to me, but the next day they did. My dad was passing the school and he went in to see Mr. Allen but he was not in his office. {MOORENDS ABOUT 30YRS AGO.} In the fifties the children went to bed between 8 and 9 o'clock and they had no hot-water bottles.
